intro: Ardisia hortorum, commonly known as the common ardisia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are a key feature of its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shaded garden landscapes. Ardisia hortorum is also valued for its ability to tolerate a range of environmental conditions, contributing to its widespread cultivation.
